thread.title: Man feeding 800kg crocodile attacked at Sandakan farm - Nation | The Star Online
thread.title_full: Man feeding 800kg crocodile attacked at Sandakan farm - Nation | The Star Online

author: Stephanie Lee
title: Man feeding 800kg crocodile attacked at Sandakan farm - Nation | The Star Online
text:
Tuesday, 21 February 2017 | MYT 4:18 PM Man feeding 800kg crocodile attacked at Sandakan farm by stephanie lee A file picture of a crocodile taken at a farm in Malacca. 
KOTA KINABALU: A man was attacked by an 800kg crocodile named Bujang Lapok when he tried to pet the reptile after feeding it at the Sandakan Crocodile Farm on Monday. 
It is learnt that the 35-year-old part-time bird carer at the farm was feeding the 60-year-old crocodile a chicken at about 1.45pm. 
After he fed the 5.5.m long crocodile, the man starting rubbing it on its snout but the reptile unfortunately turned on him. 
A fellow employee who saw the incident ran to his aid and managed to force the crocodile to let go of the man. 
Sandakan police chief ACP Mohd Azhar Hamin said the victim lost his right leg and his right arm was mangled due to the attack. 
"He has been sent to the Sandakan district hospital for treatment," he said in a statement.
